problem.markdown:
>>Here’s a starting point for you: Design a Howe Truss that has a span of 40m and a height of 8m. Apply a load of 120kN at the center of the bridge and calculate the force in each member of the truss. Which members are in tension? Check all that apply.<<
[ ] The members along the top [ ] The diagonal members [x] The vertical members [x] The members along the bottom
[explanation] When using the simulation, look at the colors of the segments and at the forces on the left side. The red beam AB has a force of 96kN, which is listed as -96kN since it's a compressive force. Now look at the blue beam AC and you can see it has a force of 75kN and is a positive number. This means it's a tensile force. [explanation]
